rules: 1. The contest shall consist of solving a series of challenges to reach the goal.

2. The contest will mainly deal with computer-based puzzles and tasks. Your knowledge of Computers, the internet (latest happenings around the world) and related technical and Non-technical stuff will be put to the test.
1. Title and names of the group members should be mentioned.
2. Two presenter per team max.
3. Presentation time of 7mins per team to present idea followed by questions from judges.
4. Contents should be clearly listed using appropriate fonts and colors
5. Use of proper headings/subtitles are desired.
6. Content should give idea of what the project is about
7. Decision made by the Coordinator/Company will be final incase any problems
8. Mode :Microsoft Team
1. Only registered teams will be allowed to share their game applications.
2. The team will be able to work on their project from 28th September onwards to 6th October.
3. Once registered all team members must join the WhatsApp group as all schedule announcements will be made on it.
4. The WhatsApp group will also be used to share resources on how to make games to help newer developers such to encourage more participation.
5. A minimum of 1 level of your game must be completed.
6. You can create either one of these types of games: Mobile, PC (Windows), Web
7. Augmented reality and virtual reality applications are also allowed
8. Your games will be judge according to the following criteria of Theme, Core gameplay, Asset diversity, Technical implementation, Presentation.

9. You will be allowed to use any individual assets, but you cannot use any full scene or full game prefabs. (E.g., A premade house model is acceptable, but a full scene with the player and environment already made is not.). For further details you can contact the coordinators.
10. Once completed you must share the link to your game application to us using any online storage service (e.g., google drive) before 7th October 2021 10:00 a.m.
11. Then on the very same day we will evaluate and pick the few best projects and they will have to explain a little about their game on the 8th of October 2021 will the judges try out their games.
12. The winners will be announced on 9th October.
13. For further questions contact the coordinators.
1. Participants will have to sign up online via the Website. Registration can be done before 10 am on Day1.

2. The participants need to ensure that the necessary pre-requisites/working environment is set up on their laptops in advance so that time allotted during the hackathon is not spent on software installations.
3. Individual applications.
4. Developed Solutions should be original and not copied.
5. Do not use proprietary software. Use open-source software.

build-startup.event-name: Building a Startup of the Future, Now!
rules: 1. Registration for the workshop should compulsorily be a group participation. The minimum number of members should be 3 and maximum 5 in a group.
prize: A 6-month long internship opportunity at Hexcoderz.
Guidance to actually build the startup and launch to market.
Access to their startup studio over the weekend to build products.
